sub_title: Certified management Consultant (CMC),  Master in Change Management (MCM), Veranderkundig adviseur
summary:
I am a consultant. Eager to play a part in complicated change processes. Obviously I can only perform is this particular role with a sustained amount of independency. But I am also a civil servant. Quite proud to be one actually. I strongly believe there is a deep sense of moral integrity within the public service.  And a commonly shared wish to attribute to provide for an open and trust-worthy society. 
A society which cannot do without The Netherlands being an active member of the international community and vice versa.  Therefore: I am an consultant how doesn’t find it difficult to adapt to my clients’ questions, because I understand and can adjust to their needs. But because I am also loyal to craft-, my skills as a consulting professional methodology I can retain my independency at the same time. 

The dilemma between the independency of the consultant and being a civil servant  has been  eminent right from the start, and is quite clear to me. Therefore, I am confident am able to cope with it, but even put it to good use. This has to do with my biography:
I like to think of myself as a versatile consultant. In fact a versatile person. This is who I am ever since I can remember. I liked science classes in high school. But I also like art. And music, And sports. And languages. And computers. I like to write. And any technical issues that come along with a job; such as logistics or governance issues.  At first glance you could look upon my summary as an erratic curriculum (see below). A guy who is incapable of making a real choice in life. But to me my life story has become quite comprehensive in any question were my talents were called upon. My job as a  consultant within the Dutch/ European Government has made that clear to me. If there is any job which might merge different talents; I’ d say it would be a consultant involved in governmental issues.

profile_positions.description:
Ik ben organisatie- en veranderkundig adviseur in dienst van de Belastingdienst. 
Binnen de Belastingdienst is momenteel een reorganisatie gaande. Samen met mijn collega’s help ik in de vraagstukken die voor de directie worden opgeworpen verder te brengen. Die vraagstukken bewegen zich over alle aspecten van het ontwerp van de organisatie: de structuur, het bestuur en de cultuur. 

Ik ben een veelzijdig adviseur die in principe op alle drie de thema’s een bijdrage kan leveren. In mijn aanpak hecht ik veel waarde aan de (fysieke-) dialoog. Ik ontwerp en begeleid bijeenkomsten met degenen die aan het stuur staan van het vraagstuk en dat samen tot een goed einde willen brengen. 
Soms verloopt deze samenwerking problematisch of komt het proces vast te zitten. 
Ik word er dikwijls bij gevraagd als dit in een bestuurlijke omgeving binnen het Rijk speelt. Wat ik dan merk is hoe het inhoudelijke proces weer op gang komt als er weer een helder inzicht ontstaat van de onderlinge verhoudingen en een gedeeld beeld van het resultaat dat niet ander bereikt kan worden dan in samenhang. Ik gooi soms zelf ook dikwijls ‘een inhoudelijk kwartje’ op om het proces weer op gang te krijgen of bij te sturen.
Al doende begin ik me op zo een eigen opinie te vormen over hoe de organisatiedoelen van de Belastingdienst zich verhouden tot besturen-, medezeggenschap-, arbeidsparticipatie en bestuurlijke samenwerking. Mijn ambitie is om die opinie te laten groeien tot een prikkelende- maar waardevolle inhoudelijke bijdrage aan hoe de Belastingdienst/ cq de Overheid in termen van bestuurlijke verhoudingen en arbeidsparticipatie goed kan functioneren.

profile_positions.company: Adriaan Bekman's 'The Language of the Soul'
profile_positions.description: In the  organizations and communities in which we live and work we direct a lot of our time and energy towards measurable targets and results. Data - fit to be recorded in spreadsheets and tables - provide at first glance easy material to discuss. Although important, there is a vivid, dynamic and very much driving 'inner world' present in organizations which is much harder to bring to words. Therefore Adriaan Bekman asked me to form a band together: 'The language of the Soul'. Recently Adriaan also published a book and a CD on the subject. We perform with a mixture of music, art, dance and written text to provoke a conscious and sense giving dialogue about the soul of the organization.

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Sociale Zaken en Werkgelegenheid
profile_positions.description: I developed and delivered a training program:  'Call Center Professional' (CCP) aimed to prepare non Dutch speaking inhabitants of the Netherlands to work in technical support call centers. The program involved both computer troubleshooting skills and communication skills. The course, exams and degree were endorsed by the customer support departments of HP, IBM, Stream and Sykes. In two years around 220 students graduated this course; 90% of whom started to work in tech support callcenters within two weeks after graduation.
profile_positions.title: Trainer developer and trainer

profile_positions.description: In the ninetees Stream International (currently registered as 'Stream Global Services') was a fast growing company delivering customer services on behalf of computer and software vendors. It included  multi lingual call centers in The Netherlands, Ireland, Germany and France In this job I developed, delivered and managed training programs on both 'hard' and 'soft' skills for the technical support agents. But it also involved consulting on complex change issues. Stream gave me my first experiences in my current trade of management consultancy, but above all: I had a great time!
